column4: OK guys, I'm back after nearly a week of my cable internet being down. Unfortunately, I have an issue.

I can't use the internet for more than a few minutes before it dies out on me. Pings don't work, sites don't work, nothing. However, I think it is a problem with my DNS, because I have no issue with bittorrent
If I restart the network interfaces (/etc/init.d/networking restart) it works again, for a few minutes.
after it dies, can you still ping something by IP?
Not sure, let me see.
well, I have to wait for it to die, but let me at least grab the IP of google.
in the mean time, is there a way to hardwire the IP of your DNS server into ubuntu? I used networking in the admin menu, but it didn't work. every time it dies, it just resets it to something else.
/etc/resolv.conf
ok, i'll try that.
OK, it died again. I'm still connected to IRC, and I can ping by ip, but not by host name
is your nameserver correct and up?
I'm correcting it now. Lets see if it dies on me again in a few minutes.
OK, it happened again. Lets see if it reset my resolv.conf
Yup.
ok
can I write protect that, so that it can't screw with it?
shouldn't have to
It resets it all the time. When it does, I can't connect any more.
Yup, that's the issue. I just restarted my network service, and it stuck the correct IP for the DNS server into the file again.
cool
problem is, it keeps changing randomly. I need it to stop chainging.
